intro: Ferula prangifolia, commonly known as the Persian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white to pale yellow, arranged in complex umbels, and it produces a distinctive, strong-smelling resin. Ferula prangifolia is often found in rocky and arid environments, adapting well to harsh climatic conditions.
